TopicTitle: HOCgaming's THAT'S NO MOON! Base - Craft Submission Thread

Articles.Content:
Say hello to the Munar Mk1 Habitat Module.

The total Mass for this ship is 8.3 tons.

It has 4 medium sized solar panels and has a Storage capacity of 2000 units of charge.

It can fit 6 kerbals easily and has 8 total docking ports.

Holds 320 units of RCS Fuel. 4 thruster blocks.

One small Advanced SAS

4 Lights for aided docking.

Docking Ports

-2 Small for probes

-3 Shielded

-3 Regular.

Action groups

1: Solar panels

2: Comm dish

3: Shielded Ports.

Images:

http://imgur.com/Gg4ZVtA

http://imgur.com/4n7XQJq

Download:

http://www.fileswap.com/dl/33mzY9hQtJ/

Hi Its Matthew Milroy (FASEGold) here, i have just completed the space station, it is a little more than you asked for as the mass is 0.115 more heavy than it can be but still it is and alright build as it is also a refuel station as well as a habitat, hope you enjoy

TMA LOOP

It's the number one solution for space agencies with a small wallet, because it's a space station core and a communication satellite at the same time! 100% functionality with only 50% of the costs!

Edited May 12, 2013 by WearingStorm
Corrections

From Hellfire Laboratories; we are pleased to announce our first ever published Space Craft for public purchase. This simple, even basic design should fulfil any required roles as a Waypoint in Low Munar orbit.

Introducing the first Low Mun Orbit Bus Shelter (working titleÃ¢â‚¬Â¦) complete with a one Kerbal mini bus, able to take Kerbals far from the orbit; and if you purchase the Blueprints now; the full sized Mun Bus will come absolutely free!

Give us some Details! I hear you cry! Well, the Bus shelter itself comes with one HitchhikerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s module, for all your Kerbals to relax and have a cup of tea while they wait for their rides to dock; complete with 3 protruding support struts with ladders to grab hold on approach from the surface cannon; 16 RTGÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s and various science equipment, this small module more than surfaces to occupy your Kerbals as they take a break between commutes. And for all you space craft needs, this shelter comes complete with 2 large docking ports, and 3, yes 3! Jr. docking ports.

This Station weighs in at only 5.4 t, and includes only 76 parts; which, if you like that minimalist approach, can be severely decreased by dropping the science equipment and some of the power sources. (However, a mini-bus is attached, bringing the weight up to 8.6t and 87 parts)

The Mini-bus, is a simple and elegant design, powered by an efficient engine, attached to a small amount of fuel and RCS, a good pilot will be able to make these Resources go far! It has a Docking port Jr. on its nose to dock with the Bus Shelter. This little gem has a mass of 3.23, and includes only 11 parts; but donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t be fooled by its size, it has a lot of Ã¢â‚¬Å“bangÃ¢â‚¬Â for its Ã¢â‚¬Å“buckÃ¢â‚¬Â

And finally, the full sized Mun-Bus, able to take 3 Kerbals far from the station, it has the next size up in everything that the mini bus has, and completely optional, with one large docking port on its nose! Finally, this was originally designed to be attached to the shelter during launch, but HellfireÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s testing dept. found a way to downsize the rocket; nice one you brainiac Kerbals at Hellfire LaboratoriesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ Testing Divisions. This original design has a mass of 17.47t, and a part count of 21.

For any users out there; action groups are as follows:

1 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ activates all the ladders and equipment on the Shelter;

2 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Activates solar panels on the buses.

ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s so simple even your tiger could do it. (Hellfire laboratories will take no responsibility for Kerbals attempting to get tigers, or any other creatures, including Jebediah; crashing the buses, or otherwise inconveniencing your space programmes)

http://imgur.com/gallery/mLLqE Image Gallery

http://db.tt/9cS7nbZj Craft Files

PS: this is the first craft IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve felt comfortable submitting, its not much, but I like it, so while I donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t expect to get picked, as it doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t stand out, I would love some feedback; I just got carried away with the sales pitch, was kinda fun

Cheers guys

From the creator of the Hephaestus Cannon Mk. II, SaganPie Industries proudly presents:

THE MY LITTLE SPACE STATION STARTER PACK!

Here's the download: http://www./?0o6fd0cyd8yt2mo

This sleek, visually-stunning space station core has it all:

- Sturdy construction!

- Lights for night-side docking!

- Plenty of batteries and solar power, plus additional backup nuclear generators in case those Kerbals get a bit clumsy!

- Lots of fuel and monopropellant storage!

- Enough space for seven Kerbals (cockpit included)!

- Parking space on all six axes!

That's right, you get all of this for the low low price of free, all wrapped up in a (relatively) small 88 part, 31.805 ton package! (Hey, you give me room for 40 tons, I'm gonna use it! )

The MLSS Starter Pack in a 1,000,000 meter orbit

And, as an added bonus to all you ambitious Kerba-nauts who want to build space stations but don't have the time to actually *build* them, I present to you the rest of the My Little Space Station line of high-quality space station modules (At least the ones I've made so far ) With just a few clicks, you can have it all, from massive fuel silos to communications arrays to escape pods!

Download here! http://www./?9ncq786u4u0qwd4

That's all for today, have fun!

-SaganPie

Woops, forgot part count :/

Hello everybody!

As demand for light, sleek, expandable station cores rises only one Mouse can enter into this contest!

This is my first entry into the "That's No Moon.. Base" Community Build,

it's designed with the intention of being easy to handle with enough fuel for munar burns and an engine that can be jettisoned revealing the 5th docking port! The core already has the capacity for 4 Kerbals, as well as ample electricity generation hidden on the underside. This electricity powers communications arrays and two lighting arrangements which allow for future screenshot opportunities. Perhaps you could

fit a larger cannon onto the underside port for blasting travelers back to kerbin.

Entry Name: "BBB" Bill & Bob's Brainchild

link to Mediafire dl: http://www./download.php?jaj5vb8a5ui5ygq

Here's a shot of it in the VAB:

And various levels of lighting:

no lights

ship lights only

all lights

I realize this design may be shot down for including a fuel tank and an engine, but without them the shape and style of the craft are lost imo.

If you really like the design feel free to use or tear off the fuel tank/engine. If not, I cant wait to see what you pick!

Edited May 13, 2013 by Mouse452

This thread finally made me register.

Introducing the Catchers Mitt custom built to "gently" guide errant Kerbals into it's chewy center

Statistics:

<22 tons

107 parts

See it in Action!

Featuring a small amount of Monoprop for positioning

Enough battery life to last the cold dark night

Well lit "Target area"

Fore and Aft docking ports

Notes:

Doesn't really need the struts between the panels I just liked the look.

"1" toggles both ladders. Access to both Hitchiker and command module confirmed

For staging, a decoupler and a empty fuselage will clear the bottom ladder.

.Craft file can be downloaded -> http://www./?zahju1fgd77ypim

Introducing the Catchers Mitt custom built to "gently" guide errant Kerbals into it's chewy center

Wish id thought of something this brilliantly simple, a big bowl to catch them in... its amazing

Simple, elegant, and not bad on the eyes

Name of Entry:

Sabre Industries LOES (Low Orbit Easy Stay)

Sabre Industries would like to introduce their first creation in their range of Low Orbital Short Term Habitation Units. The LOES.

Equipped with 16 Thermoelectric Generators for all your Power needs, and sporting accommodation for 10 Kerbals (crew included) and large ladders for easy rendezvous, Should be your first choice in Low Orbital Home or Workplace Stations.

Screenshots:

http://imgur.com/OYaHj3I

http://imgur.com/y0GE2fQ

Mass & Specs:

12.02 mass units

33 Parts

Craft Files:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/wffduzugabbpbin/LOES%20MK%20I.craft

Action Groups:

1) Toggle Ladders

Station Features:

2x Clamp-o-tron Docking Ports

8x large ladders for easier grabbing.

4x Lights to see what you're aiming for if you're on the dark side.

800 electric Units for all the power you'll ever need.

*Notice*

The LOES is built using no clip to hide The generators (placed between the command pods and the HSC.

the batteries are in part to balance the ladders.

Avoided using solar panels to avoid injury to Flying Kerbals .

Credit to JonoRig, who I first got the idea for ladders from, and jshap70 for the overall feel. thought I could combine Ideas for the best of both worlds. (and remove Hazardous Solar Panels.)

Edited May 13, 2013 by DeathSabre

Name: Mun Transfer Station

Size:

25 parts with 9,385 Mass units.

Capacity:

8 Kerbals and a big tank of RCS fuel

Features:

- Probe Core, will not be debris without kerbals

- Which means: It's empty, no return flight needed

- Two big docking ports as well as two small ones, no worries about incomparbility

- Well-placed lights that light up the entrances as well as the docking ships (can't see the 2 on the back side pointing outwards on my screenshots but they are there)

- only one generator to power them all as well as the probe core, no solar panels to bump into

- RCS with a big tank

- 2 ladders reaching out so you can get inside easier (I fiddled with more ladders but they don't help if you can't climb to the entrance with them)

- fully tested, I brought it in Mun orbit myself without any mods

Screeshots (on the dark side of the mun to show the lights):

Download:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/6fkdqo2tdxr6za4/Mun%20Tansfer%20Station.craft

The Hecate MÃƒÂ¼n station

By Clamtech Industrial

The Hecate MÃƒÂ¼n Station is a commercially build space station with the purpose of housing a fair amount of kerbins for 'scientific' purposes. The station has been build with compatability with emerging technologies in mind, like giant cannons that launch Kerbonauts into orbit withoud the need of a rocket. This is why we use the revolutionary KERB-NET technology, which acts as a fishnet for your kerbals, but in SPACE.

Thanks to our greatest engineers we have build this space station core module with functionality in mind, providing a multitude of docking opportunities that connect diagonally for dramatic effect.

Our engineers made sure that you will never get in the same trouble as Scott Manley's space program ran into, by tactically placing stationary solar panels the space station will never run out of power, no matter which way it faces, or even when it is in the shadow of the MÃƒÂ¼n or in that of Kerbin, and even providing your space station with battery power in case someone turned off the sun. (The amount of time depending on how much porn your Kerbals are trying to download to forget the end of times.)

And for when there is sunshine, you won't need your KerbexÃ¢â€žÂ¢ watches! Thanks to our brilliant executive board, our uni-directional communications system now also doubles as a solar clock, providing an accurate indication of time in case your batteries ran out.

With simplicity in mind, our best engineers managed to make sure that we stayed under our 100 parts limit (this includes bolts, coffee mugs, and knit hats) with a whopping total of just 76 induvidual parts, weighting at a total of 20,39 metric tons, which, considering for a space station, is in fact extremely light-weight thanks to our new PIXEL technologies which allow us to create structures as hollow as we can at sub-atomic levels withoud sacrificing structural integrity.

For your convinience we also provided a compact module filled with 20 kPadsÃ¢â€žÂ¢ in order to either control the space station remotely withoud any Kerbal intervention required, or to keep your Kerbals entertained with the thousands of apps available on this convinient and compact device that we never got purely for advertising reasons whatsoever.

Photographs of our station in preperation of private ventures by our own company can be found here: http://imgur.com/a/kS1ek

Thanks to new emerging technologies of subliminal advertising, we can afford to give away the blueprints of this station core for FREE! All you have to do is subject your mind to all kinds of subliminal messaging that will urge you to buy the products of companies like Rockomax industries so we can earn money on the advertising.

(Download link: https://www.dropbox.com/s/h0wuta12x5zvn5y/Hecate.craft )

Manual 1.01beta:

Step 1: Print space station core with 3D printer files provided

Step 2: Design and build launch vehicle

Step 3: Launch into Space

Step 4: Activate groups 3 and 4 to deploy the communications array and the Kerb-Net.

Step 5: Attach modules

Step 6: ???

Step 7: Profit!

-Ports = 2 Shielded

Bob Preparing for Launch

I had an idea for a very fancy space station core, that can be used for artificial gravity system and/or propellantless propulsion system (fuel-transfer-based). Here is my prototype:

(unfortunately, these screenshots don't show that middle part is spinning at about 1 RPM, but I'm too lazy to record a video)

So far I have a 8-wheeled glitchy spinny thingy, which uses tons of RCS to start, stops really quickly, and doesn't conserve angular momentum. The reason for all of these problems is that docking ports are too close and they magnetize to each other. Is there a way to disable it, or at least reduce the range? Do small docking ports have the same range as regular ones?

Also, I wonder, what other conservation laws it can break... Maybe I can use it for a propulsion system that doesn't use any fuel, and is faster than fuel-transfer-based ones... But I'll leave this for tomorrow. Today I need to rethink the design, and rebuild it, so I can move the docking ports further apart.

Edited May 14, 2013 by DiEvAl

Edited May 14, 2013 by DiEvAl

Introducing a basic station with less-than-basic features, the FSS. This station is designed with a few key traits in mind

1. simplicity

2. Ability (usefulness)

Some basic facts

The craft: FSS (Frakkin Simple Station)

Manufacturer: Zokesia Skunkworks

Part count: 33

Mass:32.22

Supplies:

1,805 units electric charge

990 units fuel

1210 units oxidizer

750 units monopropellant

Download Here!

Why this craft?

Well, to start, it is designed around a comfortable lifestyle for the kerbals inside. Sure, we could have just slapped on a Hitchhiker Storage Container, but who knows what they do in there. So instead, we have an available 6 seats, one of which is taken by the pilot, for an available 5 Kerbonauts, with stunning views all around the ship. So no more cramped hitchhikers!

Next, it has a massive fuel system. Holding in 990 units of fuel, this craft has an orbital Change of Velocity (delta V) of 3278 m/s, meaning this craft can go from kerbin orbit to munar orbit easily, with room for mistakes, thanks to the 3 nuclear engines onboard.

For spacecraft docking operations, there are 3 docking ports attached radially along the fuel tank, and a large RCS tank, allowing for refueling.

Finally, it has a great lighting system. With 6 lights, 3 solar panels, and 3 battery arrays, This craft can stay lit day or night without worry,for those pesky nighttime operations.

What does this all add up to? A simple, low part count station with great capacity, long range, and incredible usefulness, and all in a package that is far simpler than any of the competition.

Edited May 21, 2013 by exbyde

-by Tohilwifu Metagalactics Inc.

Basic Information

  • Battery: 600
  • MonoProppellant: 750

The Tohilwifu Orbiter S1 is a small and compact orbiter with a good amount of versatility. Despite it's relatively small size and weight, it can house a number of Kerbals as well as dock up to 6 vessels.

The craft itself actually doesn't come with any fuel or engines. Simply launch it into orbit then detach any unwanted parts.

Edited May 15, 2013 by Momentosis

Didn't have more time to work on the bearing station yesterday. I'll come back to it after I experiment a bit with using docking ports for propulsion.

EDIT: But I remembered one very important thing: if 2 objects aren't physically connected, they'll eventually drift apart. And even having them interlocked like in a bearing doesn't prevent it. If you turn on time warp, they'll slowly drift apart through each other. Obviously this is not an acceptable behavior for a space station or a warp drive, or pretty much anything else. So I discontinue these two projects.

Edited May 15, 2013 by DiEvAl

Name of Utility: Munar Web Station

This lovely station consists of a mere 207 parts, most of which are the simple ladder rungs, and weighs in at a smidge under 23 mass units. While the part count is high, there is no drop in performance on my run of the mill PC, and considering this is to be in orbit, rather than next to all the other utilities, I consider it worthwhile. With room for 7 kerbals and a docking port for any interplanetary bus services, this small station is both functional and pleasingly aesthetic. A care free attitude to safety regulations has meant that small leaps of faith between each spar are occasionally required.

Screenshots

Total Mass of Utility: 22.77T

Utility's .CRAFT file: https://www.dropbox.com/s/607cde8ndki4wdg/Munar%20Web%20Station.craft

I'm currently playing Kerbal with a broken hand, so forgive any misplacement of objects Any constructive criticism is welcome!
